page.title: 03NORTH HUISH COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: The area is traversed mainly by two roads - one from Ugborough/Plymouth to Avonwick/Modbury joining at Wells Cross, and the others crossing at Kitterford Cross. All {Crossroads} are named, e.g. Wells Cross, and at these points there are signposts to assist the traveller. There are also many minor lanes which are very narrow, having a few passing places, which are essential as the lanes will generally accommodate only one vehicle at a time. There is NO public transport; hence the need for residents to own at least one car, however old and utilitarian. There is a network of{public footpaths,}most of which are regularly used throughout the year, and by a few visitors in the "Season". No Post Office, but mail collection & delivery by van daily. a {telephone exchange}sited at GaraBridge
